title: If You Can End The Game, End The Damn Game
body:
I know it's fun to suicide into the enemy turret, zhonya's, use your flash, etc. etc. as the game is about to end

But when the Nexus is 2 hits from dying and you've been fucking around the enemy base without ending, you give them a chance to come back.

And that's exactly what just happened in my last game. Draven was too occupied poking Elise in the enemy spawn that they all came back up, killed everyone, took Baron and ended the game. One person turned a win into a loss.

It's hard to say if it was an intentional troll or not, but can people seriously stop screwing around in ranked matches, please?

*Only a little salty*

replies.body: League players are not very smart.
That's an understatement.
Hey! I'm very intelligerf, ok? Graves izn't bro-ken.
{{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}}

Yasuo is a balanced, fun champ, and a perfect example of a flavorful character. Everyone should be balanced around him

/s

> [{quoted}](name=VulDread,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=06PW8VNv,comment-id=0003000100000000,timestamp=2016-10-08T21:02:33.386+0000)
>
> Yasuo is a balanced, fun champ, and a perfect example of a flavorful character. Everyone should be balanced around him
> 
> /s

Yasuo mains are the most sportsmanlike ranked queue players in the entire game.  When they don't have him available, they still increase the chances of winning with their positive attitudes and superior mechanics on other champions.
{{champion:92}}  mains are probably the most respectful and humble mains out there, stealing a kill will do nothing to tilt her.
She will happily give the kill to you
{{champion:157}} never blame their teammates and always try to improve their play.

many champs will be

yasuo is very balanced and is fun to play against. He has flavor I don't really care much about but its there and that's what counts!

no sarcasm, lots of chesthair
Chest hair?  Leona and Vi both have manlier playstyles than Yasuo.

talking about my chesthair. yasuo seems ok to me. One thing I dislike though is when yasuo has the option of playing passive.. its awkward to watch but usually he kindof doesn't I think unless I give that option to him

The smurtnuss of League players is faymoose, they are the be smurt, u teh dum.

But really though, Iv said many times in the past. We have a lot of ~~kids~~ not very mature players playing this game. The younger a person is, the less they tend to have forethought, empathy, and selflessness. From experience, I can say that the average League player is shortsighted, blames you for things they are doing, and is typical so self absorbed they would rather get a double-kill for themselves than help the team wipe out the other team. So basically, the average League player is pretty childish.

This is why most critical analysis by other players starts with pointless snipes that will start people typing instead of focusing on the match, and devolves into "NO IM NOT, YOURE STUPID!"

At any rate, to the OP's point, yes, always be trying to win; dont drag it out... if you play with your food long enough, it might bite you back.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7M0nlqLpqNY

> [{quoted}](name=Kivolan,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=06PW8VNv,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-10-08T11:14:17.219+0000)
> But when the Nexus is 2 hits from dying and you&#039;ve been fucking around the enemy base without ending, you give them a chance to come back.

I've had this happen about 3 times this whole season. It's infuriating when a sure win turns into a defeat 30 seconds later.
Especially when it's ranked...

Agreed. Once i had a game where we dominated the enemy team and started stalling, following them around and messing around. Well nedless to say lategame happend, they got tanky as hell and we got destroyed.
Talk about learning the hard way XD

There was a time when I could have ended the game once. But instead of hitting the nexus, I danced like a fool in front of the fountain, taunting my opponents.
I don't really want to say what happened next.
{{champion:53}} HA HA HA HA
shut up I need to boost my kda
Maybe you're losing LP, but you now have mastery level 7!
"WURF"

If I have a player on the team refusing to finishing off the Nexus (and thus securing the win) with fooling around, and then manages to die - or as I have experienced, a trollhibitor respawning, making the Nexus invulnerable again - and we end up losing as a result, I report that player for intentionally assisting the enemy team.

I simply don't condone stupidity. And if someone then manages to make the comment "relax, it's only normal", well... I very rarely want to punch someone, but when that happens, I really do want to do it. I play to win - not to watch people deliberately throw games.
Relax, LP won't make you money.

What LP!? I got to Gold V, and don't care for higher. Deliberately ensuring 4 other players wasted 45 minutes deserves a punch. Doesn't matter what queue it is. And if the 5 seconds it takes to realize what just happened after the hit isn't a worthwhile trade for the one responsible - tough luck for him.

Ever since I myself did a similar thing to that Draven (Though I was just killing minions) and lost my team the game because of it  I've never screwed around like that anymore if we can potentially win.

that's what shitty adc mains have been doing for years and costing games tryna fish for  akill at the enemy spawn chasing around a JANNA for a pentakill etc etc. one the reasons i'm mad towards everysingle adc main.
not just adc mains but every fucking player ever
No, I need more farm for that S rank.
but but but it does not count as a win if shaco is not doing his dance right next to the enemy nexus on the win screen

> [{quoted}](name=Kivolan,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=06PW8VNv,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-10-08T11:14:17.219+0000)
> *Only a little salty*

That's actually very impressive

What hurts more is when the entire team just stands there showing their masteries, dancing, letting minions slowly kill the nexus then the enemy team respawns, aced, and their minion waves spawn holding off ours, and then inhib spawns protecting the nexus for their team to push and end..  

Is this what riot means when toxic players lose more games?
Dancing makes the inhibitors come up faster kappa
best part is getting to the nexus and surrendering. GG :D

Did that once in a premade 5 with my friends.

It was because the enemy team had 2 ppl AFK / DC, but didn't surrender or get salty, so we got to their nexus, and surrendered.

I always say yes to that only because someone thinks ohhh the last 2 people to vote are gonna say no.... and i always wait to be that deciding Vote to say yes! because i mean who told them to try and pull that off hahahaha! that's what they get for trolling, they get trolled.

You ever have it when you are dominating and someone thinking it would be funny to put up a surrender vote.. and they actually all say yes??hello right here... happened to me once this season.. we were smashing them and someone puts up a vote.. i said no.. but like usual morons be morons... they all snap call yes...ty 20LP gone....
this is pretty funny when you have a five man premade in nornals, kinds messed up to do that in ranked tho
lol. What did the enemies say

I know the feel man

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZIHzJzUAy1Y

:\
if they can end but refuse to then I report for bad sportsmanship.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wU37gcTfiXU#t=7m55s

And yes, it's a ranked game.
I hate when we get an ace, i call baron cause lanes are pushed in and we can't get another tower in time, but my team decides to back with 80 percent health left...

Once I had tp and there were winions in their base and it was open nexus I think, and the enemy team was 5v4ing my team at baron and I was playing {{champion:24}}  so I could have ended quickly. 

I tped to the fight instead, said yolo and watched as the enemy team aced us, took baron, stalled what was a 20 something kill lead into a tie game, with our nexus being open.

We still won but lul never again.
One time the enemy team decided to take our 3rd inhib instead of just ending. We ended up winning
https://media.tenor.co/images/bc315e2cc9a3225d3e123c37f328f117/raw
*Brings up the Summoner's Code*
If it makes you feel any better, this happens in every team-based game.
